div.p: SCARPANTO, an iſland of the Archipelago, and one of the Sporades, lying to the ſouth-weſt of the iſle of Rhodes, and to the north-eaſt of that of Candia. It is about 22 miles in length and 8 in breadth; and there are ſeveral high mountains. It abounds in cattle and game; and there are mines of iron, quarries of marble, with ſeveral good harbours. The Turks are maſters of it, but the inhabitants are Greeks.
